trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Secure Push
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Secure Push

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send secure push notifications in Azure. Code samples written in C# using the .NET API.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send secure push notifications in Azure. Code samples written in C# using the .NET API.

trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Secure Push
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Secure Push

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Push notification support in Microsoft Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.
trans-unit.target: Push notification support in Microsoft Azure enables you to access an easy-to-use, multiplatform, and scaled-out push infrastructure, which greatly simplifies the implementation of push notifications for both consumer and enterprise applications for mobile platforms.

trans-unit.source: Due to regulatory or security constraints, sometimes an application might want to include something in the notification that cannot be transmitted through the standard push notification infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Due to regulatory or security constraints, sometimes an application might want to include something in the notification that cannot be transmitted through the standard push notification infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial describes how to achieve the same experience by sending sensitive information through a secure, authenticated connection between the client device and the app backend.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial describes how to achieve the same experience by sending sensitive information through a secure, authenticated connection between the client device and the app backend.

trans-unit.source: At a high level, the flow is as follows:
trans-unit.target: At a high level, the flow is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The app back-end:
trans-unit.target: The app back-end:

trans-unit.source: Stores secure payload in back-end database.
trans-unit.target: Stores secure payload in back-end database.

trans-unit.source: Sends the ID of this notification to the device (no secure information is sent).
trans-unit.target: Sends the ID of this notification to the device (no secure information is sent).

trans-unit.source: The app on the device, when receiving the notification:
trans-unit.target: The app on the device, when receiving the notification:

trans-unit.source: The device contacts the back-end requesting the secure payload.
trans-unit.target: The device contacts the back-end requesting the secure payload.

trans-unit.source: The app can show the payload as a notification on the device.
trans-unit.target: The app can show the payload as a notification on the device.

trans-unit.source: It is important to note that in the preceding flow (and in this tutorial), we assume that the device stores an authentication token in local storage, after the user logs in.
trans-unit.target: It is important to note that in the preceding flow (and in this tutorial), we assume that the device stores an authentication token in local storage, after the user logs in.

trans-unit.source: This guarantees a completely seamless experience, as the device can retrieve the notification’s secure payload using this token.
trans-unit.target: This guarantees a completely seamless experience, as the device can retrieve the notification’s secure payload using this token.

trans-unit.source: If your application does not store authentication tokens on the device, or if these tokens can be expired, the device app, upon receiving the notification should display a generic notification prompting the user to launch the app.
trans-unit.target: If your application does not store authentication tokens on the device, or if these tokens can be expired, the device app, upon receiving the notification should display a generic notification prompting the user to launch the app.

trans-unit.source: The app then authenticates the user and shows the notification payload.
trans-unit.target: The app then authenticates the user and shows the notification payload.

trans-unit.source: This Secure Push tutorial shows how to send a push notification securely.
trans-unit.target: This Secure Push tutorial shows how to send a push notification securely.

trans-unit.source: The tutorial builds on the Notify Users tutorial, so you should complete the steps in that tutorial first.
trans-unit.target: The tutorial builds on the Notify Users tutorial, so you should complete the steps in that tutorial first.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes that you have created and configured your notification hub as described in <link><linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Windows Store)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes that you have created and configured your notification hub as described in <link><linkText>Getting Started with Notification Hubs (Windows Store)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Also, note that Windows Phone 8.1 requires Windows (not Windows Phone) credentials, and that background tasks do not work on Windows Phone 8.0 or Silverlight 8.1.
trans-unit.target: Also, note that Windows Phone 8.1 requires Windows (not Windows Phone) credentials, and that background tasks do not work on Windows Phone 8.0 or Silverlight 8.1.

trans-unit.source: For Windows Store applications, you can receive notifications via a background task only if the app is lock-screen enabled (click the checkbox in the Appmanifest).
trans-unit.target: For Windows Store applications, you can receive notifications via a background task only if the app is lock-screen enabled (click the checkbox in the Appmanifest).

trans-unit.source: Modify the Windows Phone Project
trans-unit.target: Modify the Windows Phone Project

trans-unit.source: In the NotifyUserWindowsPhone project, add the following code to App.xaml.cs to register the push background task.
trans-unit.target: In the NotifyUserWindowsPhone project, add the following code to App.xaml.cs to register the push background task.

trans-unit.source: Add the following line of code at the end of the OnLaunched() method:
trans-unit.target: Add the following line of code at the end of the OnLaunched() method:

trans-unit.source: Still in App.xaml.cs, add the following code immediately after the OnLaunched() method:
trans-unit.target: Still in App.xaml.cs, add the following code immediately after the OnLaunched() method:

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements at the top of the App.xaml.cs file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements at the top of the App.xaml.cs file:

trans-unit.source: From the File menu in Visual Studio, click Save All.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu in Visual Studio, click Save All.

trans-unit.source: Create the Push Background Component
trans-unit.target: Create the Push Background Component

trans-unit.source: The next step is to create the push background component.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to create the push background component.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the top-level node of the solution (Solution SecurePush in this case), then click Add, then click New Project.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the top-level node of the solution (Solution SecurePush in this case), then click Add, then click New Project.

trans-unit.source: Expand Store Apps, then click Windows Phone Apps, then click Windows Runtime Component (Windows Phone).
trans-unit.target: Expand Store Apps, then click Windows Phone Apps, then click Windows Runtime Component (Windows Phone).

trans-unit.source: Name the project PushBackgroundComponent, and then click OK to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Name the project PushBackgroundComponent, and then click OK to create the project.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the PushBackgroundComponent (Windows Phone 8.1) project, then click Add, then click Class.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the PushBackgroundComponent (Windows Phone 8.1) project, then click Add, then click Class.

trans-unit.source: Name the new class PushBackgroundTask.cs.
trans-unit.target: Name the new class PushBackgroundTask.cs.

trans-unit.source: Click Add to generate the class.
trans-unit.target: Click Add to generate the class.

trans-unit.source: Replace the entire contents of the PushBackgroundComponent namespace definition with the following code, substituting the placeholder {back-end endpoint} with the back-end endpoint obtained while deploying your back-end:
trans-unit.target: Replace the entire contents of the PushBackgroundComponent namespace definition with the following code, substituting the placeholder {back-end endpoint} with the back-end endpoint obtained while deploying your back-end:

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the PushBackgroundComponent (Windows Phone 8.1) project and then click Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the PushBackgroundComponent (Windows Phone 8.1) project and then click Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: On the left-hand side, click Online.
trans-unit.target: On the left-hand side, click Online.

trans-unit.source: In the Search box, type Http Client.
trans-unit.target: In the Search box, type Http Client.

trans-unit.source: In the results list, click Microsoft HTTP Client Libraries, and then click Install.
trans-unit.target: In the results list, click Microsoft HTTP Client Libraries, and then click Install.

trans-unit.source: Complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: Complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: Back in the NuGet Search box, type Json.net.
trans-unit.target: Back in the NuGet Search box, type Json.net.

trans-unit.source: Install the Json.NET package, then close the NuGet Package Manager window.
trans-unit.target: Install the Json.NET package, then close the NuGet Package Manager window.

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements at the top of the PushBackgroundTask.cs file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements at the top of the PushBackgroundTask.cs file:

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, in the NotifyUserWindowsPhone (Windows Phone 8.1) project, right-click References, then click Add Reference....
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, in the NotifyUserWindowsPhone (Windows Phone 8.1) project, right-click References, then click Add Reference....

trans-unit.source: In the Reference Manager dialog, check the box next to PushBackgroundComponent, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the Reference Manager dialog, check the box next to PushBackgroundComponent, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, double-click Package.appxmanifest in the NotifyUserWindowsPhone (Windows Phone 8.1) project.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, double-click Package.appxmanifest in the NotifyUserWindowsPhone (Windows Phone 8.1) project.

trans-unit.source: Under Notifications, set Toast Capable to Yes.
trans-unit.target: Under Notifications, set Toast Capable to Yes.

trans-unit.source: Still in Package.appxmanifest, click the Declarations menu near the top.
trans-unit.target: Still in Package.appxmanifest, click the Declarations menu near the top.

trans-unit.source: In the Available Declarations dropdown, click Background Tasks, and then click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the Available Declarations dropdown, click Background Tasks, and then click Add.

trans-unit.source: In Package.appxmanifest, under Properties, check Push notification.
trans-unit.target: In Package.appxmanifest, under Properties, check Push notification.

trans-unit.source: In Package.appxmanifest, under App Settings, type PushBackgroundComponent.PushBackgroundTask in the Entry Point field.
trans-unit.target: In Package.appxmanifest, under App Settings, type PushBackgroundComponent.PushBackgroundTask in the Entry Point field.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, click Save All.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, click Save All.

trans-unit.source: Run the Application
trans-unit.target: Run the Application

trans-unit.source: To run the application, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To run the application, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, run the AppBackend Web API application.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, run the AppBackend Web API application.

trans-unit.source: An ASP.NET web page is displayed.
trans-unit.target: An ASP.NET web page is displayed.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, run the NotifyUserWindowsPhone (Windows Phone 8.1) Windows Phone app.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, run the NotifyUserWindowsPhone (Windows Phone 8.1) Windows Phone app.

trans-unit.source: The Windows Phone emulator runs and loads the app automatically.
trans-unit.target: The Windows Phone emulator runs and loads the app automatically.

trans-unit.source: In the NotifyUserWindowsPhone app UI, enter a username and password.
trans-unit.target: In the NotifyUserWindowsPhone app UI, enter a username and password.

trans-unit.source: These can be any string, but they must be the same value.
trans-unit.target: These can be any string, but they must be the same value.

trans-unit.source: In the NotifyUserWindowsPhone app UI, click Log in and register.
trans-unit.target: In the NotifyUserWindowsPhone app UI, click Log in and register.

trans-unit.source: Then click Send push.
trans-unit.target: Then click Send push.
